Intercepted RSA messages from a rogue botnet use unusual keys. Rumor says their moduli are Blum integers. Can you recover the flag from this ciphertext? 1038055497859020111224527261924300635782125552945560356291796445029994999801678034345696173333005204823526848963770539635176610354256054015794518081376587

n=8047943283995371479586055844900278841390351797933777224647871611228913150995791937513599821793641854746222665781067368047792550790018251353178307253590877, e=3277140473877730097919089226026600957003424341957209312723463430022475361872713413047064515305091044948373697751573968395174497341808509005272711143378389

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{l38gzgj2}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1038055497859020111224527261924300635782125552945560356291796445029994999801678034345696173333005204823526848963770539635176610354256054015794518081376587
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8047943283995371479586055844900278841390351797933777224647871611228913150995791937513599821793641854746222665781067368047792550790018251353178307253590877, e=3277140473877730097919089226026600957003424341957209312723463430022475361872713413047064515305091044948373697751573968395174497341808509005272711143378389
The lower 104 bits of p are: 83603204994558771322543996642111547131

extra_info: p=98309008456714191451381585186680841571909372219858843593927680249211647452923, q=81863741790650952743661385133929756560151788775965322817865819688180659230599, Ï†(n)=8047943283995371479586055844900278841390351797933777224647871611228913150995611764763352456649446811775902055182935306886796726623606457853240914946907356
